issue.title: [FEATURE]
issue.body:
### Describe the feature

Stack widget

### Why would it be useful to add?

To access different widget at the same time and save the space on homescreen. Neat.

### Did the feature exist in Lawnchair v2? (Play Store version)

No

### Example(s)

![Screenshot_20231027-152059_Lawnchair](https://github.com/LawnchairLauncher/lawnchair/assets/129295306/95141b4c-efae-4056-a25d-5d474b476902)


### Additional context

_No response_

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.title: Crash when deleting one of two apps from a folder on the home screen [BUG]
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

When deleting an app from a folder on the homescreen, the app crashes if only one app is left.

### Steps to reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a folder on the home screen with two apps on it.
2. Open the folder
3. Tap and hold on one of the apps
4. Click the × to remove an app
5. App crashes


### Expected behavior

For the app to place the remaining app in the location previously occupied by the folder.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Device information

- Device: Samsung Galaxy S20 FE 5G
- OS: Android 12
- App version: Version 2.0-2589


### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body: This issue is stale because it has been open for 90 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment or this will be closed in 7 days.

issue.title: [BUG] Weather no longer displayed on "At a Glance"
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

A couple days ago the At a Glance widget stopped displaying the current weather. It had been working correctly this past year that I've been using Lawnchair, but it suddenly disappeared and I have no idea why. Everything else seems to work correctly, it'll show me the battery status, and Now Playing. I've tried turning the weather off and on individually on the widget, I've tried turning the entire widget off and on, I've tried restarting the launcher and restarting my phone, and I've tried reinstalling the launcher, all to no avail. I'm sorry that I can't provide any more details, but any help would be appreciated.

### Steps to reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. I have no clue, I'm so sorry.


### Expected behavior

The expected behavior is that the At a Glance widget would show the current weather.

### Screenshots

![Screenshot_20231010-093916](https://github.com/LawnchairLauncher/lawnchair/assets/55558104/8dc2842e-eeb6-4e8b-bd12-07867e5e53e3)


### Device information

- Device: Google Pixel 5a
- OS: stock ROM Android version 13, security update August 5, 2023
- App version: 12.1.0 Alpha 4


### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body:
> Clicking on the date works fine for me

It did not work earlier today, though it does work now. When I tried earlier, clicking on any part of Google At A Glance took me to Weather.

✅ General change (non-breaking change that doesn't fit the below categories like copyediting)
:x: Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

### Describe the bug

A couple days ago the At a Glance widget stopped displaying the current weather. It had been working correctly this past year that I've been using Lawnchair, but it suddenly disappeared and I have no idea why. Everything else seems to work correctly, it'll show me the battery status, and Now Playing. I've tried turning the weather off and on individually on the widget, I've tried turning the entire widget off and on, I've tried restarting the launcher and restarting my phone, and I've tried reinstalling the launcher, all to no avail. ### Screenshots

comment.body: The Google At A Glance isn't a good alternative since it takes up more space on the home screen, and it doesn't allow you to click  on the date to open the calendar. Hope Lawnchair can fix its own At A Glance soon.

issue.title: Option to hide desktop apps from the drawer
issue.body:
Idea for a special SmartTab for the AppList:

A SmartTab with all Apps, which are not listed/added on one of the startpages.

comment.body: This would be a feature that will make all other launchers obsolete.

issue.title: Hide apps on homescreen from drawer
issue.body: Make it possible to automatically hide apps in the app drawer that are present on the home screen. Like a "no duplicates" option.

issue.title: [BUG] no more weather on at a glance after new Google app update
issue.body:
### Describe the bug

With new update from Google app the weather is not showed any more

### Steps to reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'home settings'
2. Click on 'at a glance'
3. Scroll down to 'at a glance provider select lawchair and select show weather'
4. See error


### Expected behavior

Weather must be showed at a glance 

### Screenshots

/
![Screenshot_20231014-063138](https://github.com/LawnchairLauncher/lawnchair/assets/65352884/9d5ae19d-efe1-404c-9aeb-4195cc063ef4)


### Device information

- Device: [Sony Xperia 1 mark 4]
- OS: [stock ROM Android version 13.0]
- App version: [12.1.0 Alpha 4]


### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body: The same problem, both on the latest Alpha version from a year ago and the latest Dev

issue.title: [FEATURE] Ability to choose page indicator style + Style addition request
issue.body:
### Describe the feature

The ability for users to choose the style of the page indicator since currently you can't. I also would like to propose the first new style (see example section) and it is nothing new, just a copy from a native launcher of huawei that is very good looking but simple.

### Why would it be useful to add?

The current one sucks. Also, the customization of things is not a bad thing. About the new style, it is pleasant to the eyes in my opinion.

### Did the feature exist in Lawnchair v2? (Play Store version)

No

### Example(s)


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75091899/208122956-93fd812a-5b88-4c1a-9bb9-d69bd33b550d.mp4

![Screenshot_20221216-154338](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75091899/208123510-eec6aaf5-4eba-4f52-bbfd-234e3f0ae9b5.jpg)
this screenshot is for taking the misure of the elements of the page indicator

### Additional context

Take in mind that another known launcher (nova) has the ability to choose the page indicator AND they have added this "kind" of style to their option. The point i want to make is that they did a terrible job and i hope you see the difference avoiding the same mistake. This is how it is on nova:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75091899/208125094-a9a8a932-54a9-4c4a-9dca-22408790ec23.mp4

the circles are too big, too near and the colors is not right (between the circle of the current page and the other is too "near"). it is better if you replicate the same colors of the huawei launcher using a color picker from the screenshot.
The launcher i took the video is Huawei Home. i can extract the apk of that app if you need it.
